definitions_early.verbatim: /* Temporary, in order to avoid conflicts with the same definitions in old HAL streams.*/ #undef STM_OK #undef STM_TIMEOUT #undef STM_RESET

define.name: STM_OK
define.note: It is an alias of @p MSG_OK.

define.name: STM_TIMEOUT
define.note: It is an alias of @p MSG_TIMEOUT.

define.name: STM_RESET
define.brief: Returned code for stream reset or End-of-File.
define.note: It is an alias of @p MSG_RESET.

interface.name: sequential_stream
interface.details:
This module define an interface for generic sequential data streams.
This interface is meant to be implemented in classes requiring streaming capability.
interface.note: This interface is meant to be compatible with legacy HAL @p BaseSequentialStream interface.

method.name: stmWrite
method.details: This function writes data from a buffer to a stream.
method.param: The maximum amount of data to be transferred.
method.return: The number of bytes transferred. The returned value can be less than the specified number of bytes if an end-of-file condition has been met.

method.name: stmRead
method.details: This function reads data from a stream into a buffer.
method.param: The maximum amount of data to be transferred.
method.return: The number of bytes transferred. The returned value can be less than the specified number of bytes if an end-of-file condition has been met.

method.name: stmPut
method.details: This function writes a byte value to a stream. If the stream is not ready to accept data then the calling thread is suspended.
method.param: The byte value to be written to the stream.
method.retval: If the byte has been written.
If an end-of-file condition has been met.

method.name: stmGet
method.details: This function reads a byte value from a stream. If the data is not available then the calling thread is suspended.
method.return: A byte value from the stream.
method.retval: If an end-of-file condition has been met.

method.name: stmUnget
method.brief: Pushes back a byte into the stream.
method.details: The specified byte is pushed back into the stream.
method.note: Implementing classes may have limited push-back buffer capacity or not be able to push-back at all.
method.param: The byte value to be pushed back to the stream.
method.retval: If the byte has been pushed back.
If there is no push-back capacity left.
